TopicTitle: SpaceShuttle Shorpa : STS Duna Bis, 2 Shuttles mission + Outpost (lots of pics !)

Articles.Content:
Welcome everyone ! In this thread I'll review my (second) take on the famous STS Challenge.

 

 

My first participation was more than a year ago, and I'm starting a new one, which shall include many things I've learned about building rockets since then.

I'm focusing on modules integration, packaging solutions and good-looking contraptions more than trying to be as realistic as possible.

There is no mods in this sandbox but Chatterer.

This might be pic heavy because I want to describe every part of the first flight to show how the craft handle.

 

Album list on imgur :

STS 1 : Deploying 40t. payload

STS 2 : 6 Geostationnary relays

STS 2b : Recovering the 40t. payload

STS 3 : Téléscopâté on solar orbit !

STS 4 : High altitude crew rescue

STS 5 : Minmus Space-Station : Propulsion Module

STS 6 : Hab Module

STS 7 : Science Module

STS 8 : Second Science Module, Station Complete !

STS Minmus 1 : First steps

STS Moho-Duna because why not

STS Duna Bis : 2 Shuttles + Outpost

 

The spacecraft is named Sh(uttle)Or(biter)Pa(ck), it is a combination of many improvements I had to make to my previous shuttles.

ShOrPa (Standard) main features are :

_1.5 Mk3 bay & Mk3 ramp, front bay is facing ground to use drills or dump stuff on surface.

_SSTO capacity.

_Low TWR with only 4 Nukes (140+t. empty), +5000dV.

_Fuel tanks and engines are modulable if missions requires higher thrust (Tylo?).

Orbiter main features :

_Total mass is 1065t. (without cargo).

_2x6 Kickback SRB clusters (1000dV).

_6+1 Vectors (2500dV) + 4 Rapiers to assist lift-off.

 

Here is a post which shows a few details of the design :

 

STS 1 / 1b : Launch

 

Launchpad :

Ignition & lift-off !

SRB Sep :

Burning to raise Ap :

External tank separation :

Final orbit 150x150 :

Payload separation (40t. dummy tanks) :

Re-entry burn, quite hot !

Coming down on KSC, just at the horizon :

Heavy flare to kill orbital velocity (max G during mission was only 4.8):

Turn around to line up on runway :

Final flare :

Parachutes :

Landing :

 

 

Edited March 22, 2020 by Kerbolitto

STS 2a

 

This contract required the installation of a few relays on Keostationnary, using the shuttle's bay as cargo holder.

The crew put the craft on a 2:1 orbit at KEO Ap with a 3h30 period. Using 6 sats, this means that every 2 orbits the shuttle would pass 1 hour after the previous satellite, release a new one and so on.

Once the bay was emptied, the shuttle passed 2 times through the atmosphere, and landed on the 3rd pass.

Here's what happenned !

 

_1 Launchpad and ascent :

 

 

_2 Maneuvers to KEO and sat deployement :

 

 

Spoiler

First maneuver, almost exclusively on Rapiers :

Second maneuver to get to a 3h30 period :

 

_3 Return to Kerbin's surface !

 

The ShOrPa was a bit tricky to land, it weighted more than 100t. with all the fuel left and it was impossible to fly without moving it in front of the craft.

 

Spoiler

Messed up with my screenshot, Pe was around 52k during the first pass (KSC was not reachable without using the rapiers on jet-mode)

This is the second burn with Pe at 40k (2 more passes) :

Second pass : I moved the RCS a bit so they shouldn't be that hot anymore

Final pass with Pe right on KSC :

Second bump in the mountains west of KSC :

STS 2b

 

This mission is a bonus challenge, where it is required to bring down the fuel pod that was brought up in LKO during mission 1b.

It tests the strenght of the shuttle and its ability to fly with a heavy payload.

 

1_ Launchpad & Ascent :

 

 

Spoiler

The launch happenned a bit too soon, so the crew waited its target on a higher orbit :

Rendez-vous maneuver :

 

2_ Grabbing the fuel pod and returning to Kerbin :

 

 

Spoiler

Deorbit "maneuver" :

Airfield in sight !

Flare after a first bump : landing was relatively easy with low vertical speed but 180+m/s horizontal, the shuttle performed pretty well but lacked a bit of pitch authority (it weighted 150+t. !)

 

Edited August 12, 2019 by Kerbolitto

STS 3 : Build a Space Telescope

 

The goal is to launch a space telescope around Kerbin and use 2 MMu's to assemble its solar panels. I chose instead to deploy the telescope around Kerbol (praise Kerbol!) to somewhat replicate (lol.) JWST.

 

1_ Launch and Ascent :

 

With more than 450 parts, the launch was a bit ... slow and heavy, eventually the crew made it to orbit without breaking anything (this time)!

 

Spoiler

Target orbit maneuver around Kerbol :

 

2_ Deployement :

 

Téléscopâté is designed to protect the main telescope from the light and heat of Kerbol, it's made of a central core containing high-end instruments, antennas, batteries and a few Xenon tanks. It has 4 Ion drive and RCS for station keeping. On the side of the core are docked 2 large pannels which blocks radiations, while providing energy via solar panels. Deployement started just after leavin Kerbin SOI

Téléscopâté facing away from Kerbol :

 

Spoiler

Val goes to her MMU :

First panel out & docked :

 

3_ Return maneuver and HOT capture !

 

The return maneuver was a bit heavy, involving a huge radial burn. It could have been done for 1/4 of the dV cost but one whole year before capturing was far too long for the crew. Security aside, everything went great.

 

Spoiler

Fat burn, low Pe, what could go wrong ?

Standard aerobraking : facing Normal and rolling on RCS !

Final : ShOrPa glided half the ocean east of KSC at 20km, loosing speed gradually

Trying to line on the runway after first bump :

STS 4 - Crew Rescue!

 

6 Kerbonauts went missing after getting into orbit from Woomerang aboard a prototype! KSC descides to quickly send a rescue mission with standard shuttle, approximately matching its target inclination, and see what happenned.

 

1_ STS 4 Launch :

 

Simeon seems to be mildly amused :

 

2_ STS 4 Rescue :

 

 

Spoiler

Target inclination : (ended up with 7/8°)

Departure at inclination node, after a small correction the crew had a perfect encounter :

Retroburn on target :

 

3_ Crew transfer, capturing and landing !

 

Turns out someone spilled mayonnaise on the fuse box and fried the radio!

Everyone back on the ground, no one seems to be very happy : they forgot the mayonnaise jar in orbit.

 

 

Spoiler

Return maneuver : a bit wide, the crew will have to fly a bit before landing on the runway

Last second before touchdown :

Bonus pic : ShOrPa on inverted final !

 

Edited August 15, 2019 by Kerbolitto

Well, as a long time shuttle builder I can say pretty confidently that this thing is a BEAST!!  I made a similarly designed shuttle for the Mun STS missions, but despite being fully ISRU capable, and having a roll out cargo bay for wheeled bases, a full on crew hotel, and vertical landing assistance engines it was actually horrible to fly and catastrophically difficult to re-enter Kerbin with.  Also the D-v was really poor.  I only just made it to the Mun in these missions.

 

You on the other hand seem to be rattling through these missions.  good to read the reports and keep going!  Just finished the Duna one's myself, and am currently taking a break from Shuttling by doing a Duna Elcano and Von Braun mission wrapped up in one.  Take a look in mission reports if you fancied a non shuttle read!

Good luck with the next mission!

SM
Very impressive shuttle!  But I'm especially impressed by that origami space telescope!  That's cool

@Speeding Mullet Well thanks a lot! I've flown a ton of unbalanced SSTOs and I've learnt how to improve tiny things to make a craft easy to fly, mostly with overpowered pitch authority, good roll, a second set of landing gears for rough terrain / turning the shuttle etc.. I see that we use the same kind of design, with 2 large engines pods on the side! To me it's the easiest way to balance weight & lift, or to change engine types, add or remove fuel tanks.. .

I'll have a look at your report, I have 0 patience to do an Elkano myself but I do like von Braun style ! : D

 

@Geschosskopf Thank you! The Téléscopâté™is certainly very special, and being on that orbit it does the very same job as the ground tracking station

Maybe you will also like this one I created fot @Ultimate Steve community challenge, it also fits inside a Mk3 bay but is much wider !

 

Edited August 16, 2019 by Kerbolitto

STS 5 : Space Station !

 

STS 5 to 8 missions are about assembling a space station built with 4 modules. (Propulsion, Habitat and  two for Science)

I chose to build it around Minmus because no mission are currently proposed near this moon. This flight is performed on the new ShOrPaEXT, a vacuum variant with no jet engines and 1k3+ dV on WolfHounds. TWR is approx. 0.5 and it's more confortable to perform long burns from Kerbin (to Mun or Duna for example).

 

1_ Going to LKO !

 

Hours before take-off, engineers remembered to add Bobcat pods to help during ascent because this new variant has no atmospheric engines.

 

Spoiler

Minmus maneuver :

 

2_ Capture around Minmus, propulsion module sep

 

Bill verifies the panel's deployement.

 

3_ Leaving Minmus, landing hopefully

 

Crew back to the Space Center on time for the croissants!

 

Spoiler

Return maneuver :

First pass : speed is quite high but this shuttle is less susceptible to heating problems

After a second pass through prograde to avoid loosing too much altitude, the shuttle captured and landed on 3rd  aerobraking. KSC was not in a very good position and it was proposed to glide for a bit :

Due to a scary tumbling, the crew had to finish the trip to the space center using the shuttle as a gliding (and rolling) nuke!

 

Landing was "a bit" butchered, next time I'll probably use the Mun to reduce inclination (something like 20°) so it will be more precise

STS 6

 

Mission goes on, a new payload was fitted in the bays of ShOrPaEXT and it was reinstalled on the pad with fresh boosters.

This time the cargo is a habitat module with an array of docks.

 

1_ Launch, LKO, Burn to Minmus!

 

 

Spoiler

Minmus maneuver : just like before, burn occured as inclination node to minimize dV. Crew had to perform a small correction after 1-2 days of flight to line on target.

 

2_ Minmus capture, Cargo deployement :

 

Crisory inspects the docks, everything seems to be lined up correctly !

 

Spoiler

Minmus capture and direct rendez-vous with prop module:

 

3_ Return to Kerbin after meeting with the Mun :

 

Time to lunch, debriefing can wait !

 

Spoiler

Return maneuver : prograde only, final inclination will be at 1.5°, a second maneuver at Ap after Mun encounter will lower Pe at around 40km in Kerbin's atmosphere.

Orbit after first aerobraking : (bottom left corner)

Final maneuver to close Pe near Space Center :

Flare : Stall speed is quite low which is very much appreciated by the crew!

 

Edited August 18, 2019 by Kerbolitto

STS 7

 

First science module has been delivered to the space station. It has a laboratory, a command module, another Sr dock and a wide angle M700.

The crew had too much fuel so they decided to take a small break on Minmus.

 

1_ Launch, Ascent, Injection :

 

 

Spoiler

Injection to Minmus : Again, burning at inclination node saves a ton of dV ! The crew performed a small normal burn after 1 day to align on target.

 

2_ Minmus arrival, station is almost finished ! Landing to load ice cream.

 

 

Spoiler

Capture maneuver and direct rendez-vous :

Take-off : Not every maneuver is shown since it's very cheap to fly around Minmus

 

3_ Departure burn, meeting with the Mun, landing softly :

 

 

Spoiler

Departure and Mun flyby to lower inclination :

After the flyby, pilots performed 2 more burns, one to lower Pe at 40k and another to lower inclination to 0 from 4. First aerobraking :

Final deorbit, taking place after raising Pe above 70k and waiting 2 orbits to line up on KSC :

S maneuvers to bleed speed :

Flare :

STS 8

 

Finally, last part of Minmus Space Station ! Last module contains another science lab, a telescope and a radio mast

 

1_ Launch & Escape to Minmus !

 

 

Spoiler

Minmus injection : Same stuff as usual, burn at ascending node, small correction (0.5m/s) after crossing Mun's orbit !

 

2_ Capture & rendez vous with Space-Station

 

 

Spoiler

Another direct capture including direct meeting with target :

 

3_ Some details about Sputnik & Chocolats II

Maintenance panel on the telescope, just in case you never know !

Telescope, antenna, and a spare Kodiak..?

M700 module, don't mind the shuttle in the background Jeb would be too happy.

Service module, docks and hab module.

Engines pod, they said it is supposed to thrust through the mass of the station, supposedely it carries around 1k5 dV

 

 

4_ Leaving Sputnik & Chocolats II, our crew is asked to come back on Kerbin

 

Not much interrested about that security stuff, the Kerbonauts says goodbye through the windshield.

 

Spoiler

That maneuver looks quite cool, it also reduces inclination to almost nothing. The second Mun flyby was brought a little closer (11 000m.) and a small Pe kick was enough to drop Kerbin's Pe into atmosphere.

Trying to steer onto the desert airfield on first pass :

Steering doesn't want to cooperate, had to persuade the shuttle :

Everything's fiiiiiiiine :

STS Minmus 1

 

A new mission has been added to the Shuttle Challenge and I just couldn't resist ...

It will be about the deployement of a fuel depot. First part is about deploying sats, choosing a landing site and sniffing ore in a rover.

STS What ?

 

 

Following previous successes of the competitive Shorpa, Gene Kerman tasked Gus Kerman and his teams to create a deep space design. This new shuttle will project tons of cargo and Kerbonauts everywhere at a not formidable speed !

After stripping almost everything that could take the form of thrust, ShorpaEXT was available for a first daring mission! A surface outpost was quickly thrown in with some other stuff to fill the bay before slamming the doors shut.

Here's what happenned : (dramatic ta-ta-taaaaaaaaa)

Fire through the hole !

Dispatching a few Solid Boosters above the ocean, in case Kerbals would have to live on rafts before the crew returns.

''Is this part of the plan ?''

''That's the mission ? Woohoo so beautifull !''

''Hmm... Nevermind.''

''Look I'm holding with the shuttle !''

''Get in before you fission everywhere !''

Bill is checking the drill, sadly it does a better job when he's just sitting in the cockpit.

''Okay let's go somewhere else !''

7) Time to leave !

 

Does Richard regrets to have smuggled on board ? There's not enough room to bring them back !

''Well done team, we openned up the first fuel station on Moho !''

''I'll remember it !'

''Do you think we're really dumping radioactive fuel across every planets ?''

Spoiler

Duna maneuver, almost aligned on Pe !

 

9) A bit of fresh air !

 

Shinyyy !

''Yeah you're right let's go this way !''

''Good thing we brought multiple flags''

Bill negotiates with a parachute so it repack itself

''See you later Kerbol !''

''Yeah blast it !''

 

''Cool trip right ?''

''Sure thing but I prefer Eve !''

 

Spoiler

Hitting Duna's atmoshere : not that fast !

Seconds before touchdown : (on an semi inclined ramp)

10) This time we go back ?

''This one is my favourite !''

''I recognize this desert !''

''Well, looks like they're not living on rafts after all''

''Haa best part of this mission !''

''''Conservative'''' aerobraking !

Edited September 11, 2019 by Kerbolitto

STS Laythe / Jool 5   (part 1)

 

 

After being subject to the heat of Moho and the redness of Duna in the previous mission, KSC kream of the krops decided that a bit of fresh air (vacuum) would benefit to the poor crews operatig the Space Shuttle Service.

Because Dres doesn't exist and Eve Not Today Gene prepared his teams to rendez-vous with Jool and all the stuff that floats around it.

Using the trusty Shorpa design, engineer decided to drop those useless Wolfhounds and exchange them with 2 Nervas against 2 (brand) used Vectors scavenged from the Orbiter. The body has been lengthened to accomodate an Mk3 short fuel fuselage, and half of a cargo bay has been transformed to hold Rocket fuel. Wing design remains the same, as it will still provide sufficient lift for this heavier and longer shuttle (well probably, no one tested it).

The spacecraft will navigate using 2 sets of engines depending of the needs of the mission, Vectors provides more than 1.1 TWR during around 2.5 minutes, while Nervas thrust peaks at 0.07 when everything is loaded. This adaptative combination will provide a total of something like a massive-ton of dV, more or less.

 

1_ Ascent, Departure and Arrival in the Joolian system :

 

"Snap, I forgot my camera negatives !"

"No wait guys turn around !"

"Well, will have to use the Kolaroïd instead.."

"Bye big bottle ! I hope they'll catch it in one piece this time, I feel like more Vectors could be usefull for the next assignement ...!"

"Objects in the mirror looks closer than they are"

"See ! I told you had to turn left after that last asteroid !"

"Damn, no sailboat this time ?"

"They told us they would be of different size"

Science report : This side looks a lot darker than the other

2_ Pol's Situation !

 

"They do appear closer !"

"Surveying" ... "Surveying" ... "Surveying" ...

"What's in the box Bill ?"

"Yeah more science stuff ! Thanks Bill, now check the radiators please !"

"Well, those rocks were not made of chocolate, and those spires aren't cheese either ..!"

3_ Vall Mysteries !

"Okay time to get down !"

"Actually turn to the right a bit"

"Drill me baby ?"

"Well that is enough, lets plant flags somewhere else please, it's freezing around here !"

"What did you say about Nuke thrust ?"

Science note : the more we see it, the more it looks like a green Eve .. Shiny ... !
